title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis impressed at the 2025 IIHF World Championships, scoring four goals and six points in seven games for Latvia.
Locmelis turned pro in 2025 with the Bruins, signing an entry-level deal and notching 12 points in six AHL playoff games.
Providence head coach praises Locmelis for his adaptability and courage, predicting a strong future during Bruins' training camp.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye as 'timid' in the 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Gronkowski noted Maye's lack of progression from rookie to second year, urging more assertiveness moving forward.
Drake Maye acknowledged no major changes in preparation under Josh McDaniels' offense despite struggles in Week 1.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, from Braintree, died from injuries after being hit by an e-bike in Copley Square, Boston.
Dang was struck on August 6 near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street and suffered life-threatening injuries.
The e-bike operator stayed at the scene; no charges have been filed, and their identity remains undisclosed.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Perigean spring tides, known as king tides, will cause elevated sea levels at Boston Harbor throughout the fall.
The phenomenon is due to the moon's orbit and phases, aligning with Earth and the Sun, raising tides by 2-4 feet.
The Stone Living Lab will host events at Long Wharf on specific dates to observe the tides in September, October, November, and December.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs supports quarterback Drake Maye, saying Maye can handle criticism and isn't a 'softie.'
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, one touchdown, and one interception against the Raiders.
Stefon Diggs, recovering from an ACL injury, caught six passes for 57 yards in his Patriots debut.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Audit finds DESE failed to investigate 22 supported child abuse reports from February 2020 to July 2023.
DESE delayed addressing special education complaints, with 28% experiencing an average delay of 111 days.
DESE did not fulfill obligations to the Massachusetts Commission on LGBTQ Youth, such as issuing annual materials.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk died at 31 after being shot at a Utah college event on September 10, 2025.
Massachusetts officials, including Gov. Maura Healey, condemned the violence and stressed the need to stop political violence.
Law enforcement has not publicly identified a suspect, though someone was initially arrested and released after questioning.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez, sidelined since July 28 with a hamstring injury, missed Patriots practice ahead of the game against the Dolphins.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses were absent from Wednesday's practice due to foot injuries, adding to Patriots' concerns.
Kayshon Boutte, dealing with a shoulder issue, was limited in practice but was a key player in Week 1 against the Raiders.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye admits to missing some critical throws during Patriots' loss to Raiders, including an early interception.
Patriots struggled in the red zone, converting 1 of 3 opportunities, while Raiders capitalized on their sole chance.
Maye emphasizes improving red zone efficiency and starting faster in games as key focus areas for the team.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown expressed openness to playing for his hometown Atlanta Hawks while discussing future NBA possibilities.
Brown is contracted with the Boston Celtics for four more years after signing a five-year, $304 million extension in 2023.
Amid trade rumors, Brown is set to lead the Celtics with Jayson Tatum sidelined due to an Achilles injury.
